definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: slaughter, butcher, slay (NH id. (rare) and deriv.; Ph. [[טבח]] pt.; As. ṭabâḫu Asrb:Annals iii. 56; Aram. t.bah., [[טְבַח]] (rare) and deriv.; Ar. t.abaxa cook meat, also bake bread; Eth. t’abh.a: slay)—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Pf. 3 ms. sf. [[וּטְבָחוֹ]] consec. Ex 21:37; 3 fs. [[טָֽבְחָה]] Pr 9:2; 2 ms. [[טָבַחְתָּ]] La 2:21; 1 s. [[טָבַחְתִּי]] 1Sa 25:11; Imv. [[וּטְבׂחַ]] Ge 43:l6; Inf. cstr. [[טְבׂחַ]] Ez Eze 21:15; [[לִטְבַוֹחַ]] Ps 37:14 + 3 t. (so Baer; van d. H [[לִטְבּוֹחַ]], exc. [[לִטְבָוֹחַ]] Je 51:40); Pt. pass. [[טָבוּחַ]] De 28:31; —

slaughter, butcher animals for food Ex 21:37 (E), Pr 9:2 (fig. of Wisdom's furnishing her table); so c. acc. cogn. [[טֶבַח]] ´[[ט]] Ge 43:16 (J), [[טִבְחָה]] ´[[ט]] 1Sa 25:11; cf. also De 28:31, where punishment lies in fact that the owner does not eat of the slain ox; [[כְּכֶשֶׂב אַלּוּף]] [[יוּבַל לִטְבַָוֹחַ]] Je 11:19 like a mild lamb that is led to slaughter, sim. of the prophet exposed to his enemies, Je 51:40 sim. of ´[[י]]'s vengeance upon Babylon (v. also [[טֶבַח]], [[טִבְחָה]]), Je 25:34 of kings and rulers, under fig. of shepherds & choice sheep.

poet. & fig., slay, kill ruthlessly, c. acc. pers. Ps 37:14; abs. La 2:21(‖[[הָרַג]]; opp. [[חמל]]); c. acc. cogn. [[טֶבַח]] ´[[ט]] Ez Eze 21:15 of a sword sharpened for the slaughter of Isr. in judgment.
